iso_random_matrix.definition: Isomorphic patterns in random matrix universality across scales capture statistical equivalences in eigenvalue/zero correlation hierarchies—mappings where ensemble statistics, level repulsion, and n-point functions preserve relations invariantly. Core focus: Montgomery-Odlyzko conjecture and GUE hypothesis positing Riemann zeta zero statistics as eigenvalues of large Gaussian Unitary Ensemble matrices, mirroring quantum chaotic systems. Validated via category theory (e.g., universality functors), empirical correlations, and cross-domain analogies (e.g., nuclear spectra to arithmetic zeros per 2025 moments refinements). Hard-to-vary invariants like level repulsion enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox resolution (affirm GUE match/deny classical Poisson/both in transition regimes/neither in non-universal gaps); scores >0.99 based on 2025 RMT abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from matrix theory/web and statistical overlays (e.g., nuclear levels to zeta spacings).
Validate coverage across scales; flag deviations at low heights as bounded/speculative (<3% variance).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., moments conjectures); integrate diachronic depth (Montgomery 1973 to 2025 supersymmetric extensions).
Export lean JSON; auto-export flagged low-lying anomalies to Module 0 for ratification.
Yoneda-like embeddings consume regenerative_pool: Map pruned ensemble variants into higher universality equivalences.
